title: ALTA Welcomes Sagem to its Flourishing Affiliate Member BaseTravelandtourworld.com
text:
ALTA Welcomes Sagem to its Flourishing Affiliate Member Base
Sagem (Safran) is the latest organization to join the Latin American and Caribbean Air Transport Association (ALTA) as an Affiliate Member, effective today. ALTA safeguards the interests of the region’s industry by facilitating the development of safer, more cost-efficient and environmentally friendly air transport in the Latin America and Caribbean region.
Based in Dallas, Texas, Sagem Avionics, LLC, a wholly owned subsidiary of Safran, is specialized in avionics for civil and military aircraft. Its scope of business includes marketing and sales of Sagem products, including integrated cockpit display systems, avionics illuminated push button switches, helicopter autopilot systems, flight control components, aircraft condition and monitoring systems and flight operations quality assurance software for aircraft, technical support and MRO (Maintenance, Repair, Overhaul) services. With its wide range of innovative, high-performance solutions, Sagem operates all over the world.
Eduardo Iglesias, ALTA´s Executive Director, added, “We are excited to welcome Sagem into our roster of Affiliate Members. We embrace the diversity of affiliates related to aviation and appreciate the interest of Sagem to pursue closer ties with the aviation world in Latin America and the Caribbean. The company has a long-standing presence in the region and has forged relationships with some of the major stakeholders in the industry. I believe Sagem will contribute strongly to ALTA’s membership base.”
